revised_title: Spectra of Argon: Red and Blue
tldr: The author examines the spectra of argon gas using a spectroscope and a spectrograph, discovering two distinct spectra called red and blue argon. The red spectrum is produced by a lower electromotive force, while the blue spectrum requires a higher electromotive force and a hot spark. The author also discusses the process of purifying argon gas and the differences in spectra when mixed with nitrogen.
